intro: Candarum roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals, which are typically arranged in a showy, cup-shaped cluster. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species like the opium poppy. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
